newsitem.title: BRAZIL: SOCCER-ROMARIO SHINES ON TULIO'S CORINTHIANS DEBUT.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-ROMARIO SHINES ON TULIO'S CORINTHIANS DEBUT.

text.p: Brazilian striker Tulio, making his debut for new club Corinthians, saw arch-rival Romario steal the glory with two goals in a 3-0 win for Flamengo.

Tulio, Brazil's top scorer in 1994 and 1995, was virtually invisible in a first leg of a Rio-Sao Paulo Cup match on Tuesday night, his first game for Corinthians since leaving Botafogo in a deal reported to be worth $5.0 million.
But Romario looked in fine form, scoring once in each half to underline his claims that he deserves his place back in the national team. Savio scored Flamengo's third from a penalty.
